name: Hotel des Academies et des Arts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would thouroughly recommend it. The location was suberb, with a metro line (Vivane) seconds from the hotel doorway. The staff were wonderfully helpful, aiding us in any which way they could and the rooms were lovely - we even had a bath which is not a common Parisien hotel feature!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - would go back

likes.liked: — Our keyboard in the room didn't work for internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this after reading the reviews on TA and were not disappointed. The staff are really fantastic and so helpful. The hotel is in a great location and is well appointed and furnished. We will definitely be back...
reviews.title: A Little Gem

likes.liked: — The staff and the interesting and comfortable furnishings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique property deserves all the praise it has been getting. My wife and I stayed there for four nights in early July. Everything was as advertised, especially the friendliness of the staff. I had emailed the hotel that we would be arriving about noon and, although check-in is officially at 3 pm, they had made a special effort to have a room ready when we arrived. That was a real plus after hours on a plane. Henry, the day person at the desk, is especially nice and extremely helpful in all matters. I really recommend this hotel most strongly. And, by the way, when you ask for ice, they really give you ice! That is a real plus for me as it is for most Americans.
reviews.title: The Praise is Deserved

likes.disliked: — It was a bit pricey, especially given the exhange rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Paris, though we have both travelled through Europe extensively. I feel compelled to give new visitors to Paris a bit of a warning about the Underground as it generally receives unrestrained praise. Yes it works fine if you are knowledgeble about all the recent alterations. However, if you are not, be prepared for frustrations. For example, we wanted to take a riverboat cruise on the Seine and were told to take the number 6 (I think I am remembering the number correctly) in the direction of Charles de Gaulle Airport and were given directions to the Underground station. However, when we arrived, there were no signs indicating a that the #6 had a direction of Charles de Gaulle. All that was available was direction Nation and direction Etoile. Turns out the Etoile is Charles de Gaulle, but it took some research to find out. Similarly, we took a side trip which required we get a train at Gare de Lyon. We took a taxi there, but decided to take the Underground back as the map of the underground indicated that good old number 6 stopped at Gare de Lyon. We found the entrance to the Underground and need to head in direction Etoile (we had wised up at this point). But it seems that the platform for direction Etoile was closed for some reason, perhaps for repairs. Again, a frustrating difficulty for someone unfamiliar with the peccadilloes of the Underground. Other problems we found we that the maps of the Underground are not current, though station signs are. On a couple of occasion the maps showed the direction ending at a location but, evidently, the line had been extended so we could never find the direction shown on the map. Why they don't post easily readable lists of stations like the ones which are actually in every car is beyond me. In short, being familiar with the terrific maps of the Washington DC Metro, I sure wish the Paris Metropolitan would do the same.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, again, the hotel is great. You won't go wrong. And the free wireless access to the internet is a real plus for me.
reviews.title: Compact and bijou

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: many paris hotel overpriced but this hotel was not. staff willing to go the extra mile to make you comfortable and never expect a tip but i'm sure it is appreciated. great location next to the metro. bought the 3 day unlimited pass. away from tourist section. would stay there again.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a delightful hotel in the Montparnasse District with ready access to everything!
reviews.title: Delightful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was a very comfortable size by Paris standards and the hotel decor throughout was welcoming and unpretentious. The room had a feeling of luxury and was complemented by the most wonderful shower encountered in our 6 weeks of travel!
reviews.title: An outstanding charming hotel experience in Montparnasse, Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent and the staff were genuinely warm and friendly and very helpful in pointing us in the right direction, making our stay all the more memorable.
reviews.title: What a treat!

likes.liked: — Warmth and homeliness of the hotel and staff. The location is also fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will now look forward to our next return visit to Paris, and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as an ideal place to stay.
reviews.title: Simply Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow. What an amazing weekend my wife and I have just experienced. We went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we couldn't have hoped for a better place to stay.
reviews.title: An amazing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's so easy to get to - straight there from Gare du Nord (metro line 4) and the hotel is literally around the corner.
reviews.title: Incredibly convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, well decorated and themed (check out the lift) and the staff so helpful. Paris is not brilliant for vegetarians, but Anne-Sophie on reception decided to do some research for us and printed maps, names and numbers whilst we were out sightseeing.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel! You Must Experience this Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding area is full of cafes and brasseries. You get better value for money by eating breakfast at one of these rather than the hotel, but if you want a lie-in, the hotel breakfast is probably best as you can have it until midday.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall a fantastic hotel which I would recommend.
reviews.title: A Great Paris Experience

likes.disliked: — The room could have been a little bigger but it was a normal size for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my opinion this hotel is in a good location. It is easy to get around Paris from here by either metro, bus or on foot. Very convenient for the excellent organic Raspail market and there are many excellent restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Failed to live up to expectations......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is OK. Rooms are small and expensive for what you get. The "luxury" promoted on the website is sadly not what I would call luxury. The furnishings include lots of vinyl upholstery, the bathrooms are clean but with taps which are a triumph of style over function. For a hotel which promotes its arts, art is pretty thin on the ground apart from the themed installations and wall paintings of the white figures. The walls are very thin and expect to be able to hear your neigbours every word. Also, a word of warning, the bedside lights are a halogen bulb inside a metal shade, these get incredibly hot and are an accident waiting to happen.
reviews.title: What all good small hotels should aspire to be

likes.liked: — warm and friendly style of personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a comfortable and clean room, a great location, little 'wow' value, overpriced and a hotel with some significant flaws.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of all that has been said about the aesthetically pleasing decor, the great location, the beautiful breakfasts, and enthusiastically pleasant service, I would like to commend them on going the extra mile to make a special birthday celebration go like clockwork.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In just three days, they organised 4 taxis for us, a limosine tour, confirmed and followed up on restaurant reservations, proposed a visit with the artist of the hotel, and gave us the impression that nothing would be too much trouble for us to do.
reviews.title: Location excellent - next to Vavin Metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in this amazing little hotel in Montparnasse and absolutely loved it. It's a delightfully put together place with a wonderfully helpful and engaging staff. The decor was very artsy and fun. The #4 metro stop is just steps away from the location and it was very convenient to get around. We highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with Great Staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic! The staff was so friendly and the location was wonderful. We stayed in room 33, which I would recommend requesting, it was a very good size room with two windows that opened up. The decor is modern and everything is recently renovated. A note to those traveling to Europe- we stayed at 5 hotels in four countries and NONE gave out wash clothes or hair conditioner! Two important things for a gal to have... so bring them with you. The rate we paid per night was $197.00 euro's per night (inclusive of taxes).
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside to the hotel was that the elevator was very tiny, but most of the hotels over there have this issue. Overall, great place, great location, great staff... a great place to stay in Paris!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

likes.liked: — The staff, the decor, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one night only but it I was very pleasantly surprised. The staff is really friendly and helpful and the service is great. The room was very pretty, loved the classy decorations and the beds were fantastic! The location is very close to two metro stations. The area is nice also, close to Montparnasse and the Jardin du Luxembourg. I hope to stay there again and I truly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for three nights in April 2008 after we read all the positive feedback on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

likes.liked: — Attentive friendly staff, cleanliness, area of Paris hotel is in.
likes.disliked: — Size of room - though not enough to put me off returning to hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay - the hotel is well positioned very near Vavin Metro station which is on the purple number 4 line directly from Gare Du Nord which is useful for those arriving in Paris by Eurostar.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: On arrival we received a warm welcome from Henri. As it was our first time to the centre of Paris, he gave us tips on what to do, where to go and how to get there - he, and all the staff, were attentive, kind and professional. Luckily our room was prepared early so we could go to relax before venturing out to explore the area.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was, as all reviews point out, not exactly huge - but exquisitly decorated, clean and the beds were large and very comfortable. The bathroom had a lovely big bath with powershower (great after being on our feet all day!) and were were lucky enough to have the first floor room with access to the small sitting area outside. Free internet access in the room and flat screen tv were a great addition, though, as usual on the continent, there were only two news channels - but then again, what the heck are you doing watching tv when the whole of Paris is on your doorstep to explore!
reviews.title: A Great Find

likes.liked: — Great value for money for a stylish boutique hotel in the heart of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel des Academies et des arts, 15 rue de la Grande Chaumiere.
reviews.title: Chic, Elegant and staffed by professionals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in March ’08 and had a very enjoyable time. It does not surprise me that the hotel is 4th in the Tripadvisor popularity index.
reviews.title: *** Perfect Paris hotel ***

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First – Location. This lovely hotel is a 10 minute walk from Port Royal Metro and RER station. ( So easily accessible from both Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports). The RER trip from CDG takes about 40 minutes, one way fare is €8.20, an absolute bargain.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.liked: — Funky cool style and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also served by three other Metro stations, Raspail, Notre Dame des Champs and Vavin. Vavin is only 50 metres away on Boulevard du Montparnasse, while the other two are less than 10 mins easy walk.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

likes.liked: — How clean and new it was
likes.disliked: — Very far walk from some of the major Paris sights such as the Eiffel tower, Louvre, Arc d'Triumph, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame though it is close to metro and bus lines.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was dealt with very quickly and efficiently by the lovely Patricia. The hotel is situated right across the road from a well known art school and therefore it is only fitting that the hotel itself has a very arty theme. The theme is based on the ‘White Figures’, and you will understand exactly what I mean when you stay here. Very chic, very creative, we loved it.
reviews.title: Wonderful, charming hotel
